oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Request for leave of absence for Colonel George Nixon, 20th Tenn. Cav. Regt., CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is a request by Col. George Nixon, 20th Tenn. Cav. Regt., CSA for a leave of absence to visit Richmond, Va. on government business. Nixon formerly served as Colonel of the 48th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. In late 1863, he raised the 20th Tenn. Cav. Regt. The regiment served in North Alabama, in the Tennessee Campaign, and the Selma Campaign. The request is endorsed by Gen. Phillip Dale Roddey, commanding the District of North Alabama. Roddey was known as the "Defender of North Alabama."
